p.label: Moving camp—Atsina
p.caption: Several Atsina on horses with travois behind them, tipis in background.

p.caption: Tlakluit Indian, standing on rock, fishing with dip net.

p.label: Mandan bull boat
p.caption: Mandan bull boat

respStmt.name: Edward S. Curtis Collection (Library of Congress)

p.label: New Chest—Piegan
p.caption: New Chest, half-length portrait, facing forward.

p.label: Wishham woman
p.caption: Tlakluit woman, half-length portrait, facing front, wearing a heavily beaded buckskin dress, several necklaces, beads, shells, dentalium-shell nose ornament and a headdress of beads and hollow-centered Chinese coins.

p.label: Atsina camp scene
p.caption: Tipis on plains.

p.label: Piegan Lodge interior
p.caption: Lissle Plume (r) and son Yelloe Kidney (c) seated on ground inside tipi, with woman.

p.label: Rush Gatherer
p.caption: Indian woman holding rushes.

p.label: Bear's Teeth
p.caption: Bear's Teeth, Arikara, head-and-shoulders portrait, facing front, wearing headband.

p.label: Hidatsa man
p.caption: Hidatsa Indian posed, standing, full-length, draped with blanket, facing front; with mountain in background. "Holds the Eagle" on verso.

p.label: Rabbit Head — Hidatsa
p.caption: Hidatsa Indian posed, head and shoulders, facing right.

p.label: Hidatsa woman
p.caption: Hidatsa Indian woman posed, head and sholders, facing front. "Mrs. White Duck" on verso.

p.label: Atsina Indian
p.caption: Atsina Indian on horse pulling travois

p.label: Flathead child
p.caption: Salish Indian boy, posed, wearing costume and headdress.

p.label: On the beach—Chinook
p.caption: American Indian woman standing holding a basket on beach.

p.label: Lewis and Clark Landing Place
p.caption: Lewis and Clark's landing place at Nihhluidih. Chinook Indian standing on river bank, Columbia River Valley.

p.label: Yakima boy
p.caption: Portrait of a Yakima boy, half-length, seated, with loose hair, a cloth shirt, shell beads, and a fur strip around his shoulders.

p.label: Yakima mat lodge
p.caption: Photograph shows reed mat covered tepee in grassy field, Washington.

p.label: Wishham woman
p.caption: Chinookan Indians: Tlakluit; Washington. Landscape, portrait, woman, full length, facing right, standing, wearing beaded buckskin dress.

p.label: Wasco Indian
p.caption: Half-length portrait of Indian with decorated face, feather and bead ornaments, seated, facing right, The Dalles, Oregon.

p.label: Bear rattles
p.caption: Rattles of Arikara bear medicine men.

p.label: Arikara woman
p.caption: Arikara woman, half-length portrait, facing front.

p.label: Defiance
p.caption: Indian, three-quarter length portrait, seated, facing right, in native dress.

p.label: Batchese
p.caption: Studio portrait of an Indian, possibly Salish (Flathead), half-length, seated, facing right, wearing feathered headdress.

p.label: Native with dugout canoe
p.caption: Native with dugout canoe — Celilo-Columbia River, 1897 / [Gi]fford, The Dalles, Or. Indian, possibly Wasco, seated on a long canoe.

p.label: Po-ca-tel-lo, Yakima or Umatilla
p.caption: Po-ca-tel-lo, Yakima or Umatilla Indian, from Oregon, half-length portrait, facing right.

p.label: White Shield
p.caption: White Shield, Arikara, half-length portrait, facing left.

p.label: Iron Shell
p.caption: Walter Iron Shell, Lakota, Sioux tribe, half-length portrait, facing front in traditional clothing.

p.label: Walter Iron Shell
p.caption: Walter Iron Shell, Lakota or Sioux tribe, half-length portrait, facing right, in traditional clothing.

p.label: Crow Chief
p.caption: Crow chief, half-length portrait, facing right.

p.label: Black Eagle — Assiniboin
p.caption: Black Eagle, full-length portrait, standing, facing front, wearing buffalo hide, holding wing of bird.

p.label: Red Whip
p.caption: Red Whip, Atsina man, half-length portrait, seated, facing front, wearing feather, beaded buckskin shirt, holding pipe in left hand.

p.label: Bear's Belly
p.caption: Bear's Belly, Arikara Indian, half-length portrait, facing front, wearing buckskin

p.label: Bear Legs
p.caption: Bear Legs, an Osage Indian, half-length portrait, seated, facing front.

p.label: Joseph Dead Feast Lodge
p.caption: Joseph Dead Feast Lodge—Nez Percé

p.label: The whaler—Clayoquot
p.caption: Nootka Indian standing on shore with spear.

p.label: Crow Chief's Daughter
p.caption: Piegan girl standing in doorway of tepee, wearing beaded buckskin dress, Montana.

p.label: The Grizzly Bear
p.caption: The Grizzly Bear, Piegan, half-length portrait, facing front.

p.label: Running Owl's family
p.caption: Running Owl's family (Piegan), adult woman and two daughters seated on rug floor of lodge, wearing beaded cloth dresses.

p.label: At the water's edge
p.caption: A Young Arikara Indian stands in shallow water, wearing buckskin dress, with trees in background, North Dakota.

p.label: Young Indian
p.caption: Young Indian (Quinault), head-and-shoulders portrait, facing front, wearing shell ornaments.

p.label: Wades in Water
p.caption: Wades in Water, Piegan Indian, full-length portrait, seated on floor, facing front, with braids, beaded buskskin shirt and leggings, beads with ermine tail trim.

p.label: Three Eagles
p.caption: Three Eagles, a Nez Percé man, head-and-shoulders portrait, facing left.

p.label: Substitute sacred headdress
p.caption: Piegan woman, half-length portrait, seated, facing front, wearing headdress made of ermine tails, feathers, and bunches of grass.

p.label: Dusty Dress
p.caption: Kalispel Indian woman, half-length portrait, facing front, seated, wrapped braids, white stripes painted on hair, shell disk earrings, wearing blanket dress decorated with elks' teeth.

p.label: Wolf
p.caption: Head-and-shoulders portrait of a Crow man.

p.label: Flint Smoker's daughter
p.caption: Piegan woman seated on ground in open field.

p.label: Wild Gun
p.caption: Three-quarter length portrait of Piegan family.

p.label: Legend of the peace pipe
p.caption: Siksika man with calumet and young boy inside tipi.

p.label: Mandan earthen lodge
p.caption: Earthen lodge, with bull boat by doorway, North Dakota.

respStmt.name: Edward S. Curtis Collection (Library of Congress)

p.label: Yellow Horse
p.caption: Yellow Horse—Yanktonai, half-length portrait, standing, facing slightly right, with long braids, two eagle feathers in hair, wrapped in buffalo skin.

p.label: Nez Percé man
p.caption: Nez Percé man, head-and-shoulders portrait, facing front, wearing bead necklack, with blanket over shoulder.

p.label: Standing Buffalo
p.caption: Standing Buffalo, Winnebago man, reclining on ground, rifle across leg

p.label: Big Winnebago Jim
p.caption: Winnebago man, three-quarter length portrait, facing front, seated, wrapped in blanket.

p.label: Blood camp
p.caption: Woman walking among painted tipis.

p.label: Sioux brave — "Stampede"
p.caption: Dakota man, half-length portrait, facing front.

p.label: Wife of Mnainak
p.caption: Yakima woman, half-length portrait, facing front.

p.label: Susie Shot in the Eye
p.caption: Susie Shot in the Eye, a Sioux Indian, half-length portrait, seated, facing left, at the Indian Congress of the Trans-Mississippi and International Exposition.

p.label: Two Kill
p.caption: Piegan woman, full-length portrait, seated on blankets inside tipi(?), facing front.

p.label: Wishham Petroglyphs
p.caption: Wishham Petroglyphs.

p.label: Eagle Child
p.caption: Eagle Child, Atsina man, half-length portrait, facing front.

p.label: Che-na-wah-Weitch-ah-wah
p.caption: Yurok author, Lucy Thompson, half-length portrait, seated, facing slightly right.

p.label: Scout Mobiel, in Kiowa war time costume
p.caption: Elk Tongue (Scout Mobiel?), wearing war bonnet while carrying shiled and bow, on horseback, facing right.

p.label: Arikara Medicine Ceremony
p.caption: Three Arikara men, members of the medicine fraternity, dancing, painted to represent ducks and holding rushes.

p.label: Ma-Has-Kah
p.caption: Ma-Has-Kah or White Cloud, an Ioway chief, head and shoulders portrait, facing slightly left.

p.label: Shout-At—Sioux
p.caption: Shout-At, half-length portrait, facing left, wearing breastplate and war bonnet.

p.label: Hoo-Wan-Ne-Ka, Winnebago man
p.caption: Hoo-Wan-Ne-Ka, half-length portrait, facing right, holding tomahawk.

p.label: Payta-Kootha
p.caption: Payta-Kootha, a Shawanoe warrior, head-and-shoulders portrait, facing slightly right / drawn, printed and coured at I.T. Bowen's Lithographic Establishment.

p.label: Tah-Ro-Hon
p.caption: Tah-Ro-Hon — an Ioway warrior, half-length portrait, facing left, holding calumet (peace pipe), wearing medallion / drawn, printed & coloured at I.T. Bowen's Lithographic Establishment
